channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Danish startup FlatPay joins the club of European fintech unicorns to track
item.description: Flatpay’s bet is that it can challenge larger players by charging small merchants a flat transaction rate to use its card terminals and point-of-sales...

item.title: ‘Buy Now, Pay Later’ is expanding fast, and that should worry everyone
item.description: As Morris watches his BNPL investments from the other side of the table, he seems to understand the warning signs better than most.

item.title: Are we nearing the end of Apple’s Tim Cook era?
item.description: Apple is getting serious about succession planning, according to a new report.

item.title: Beloved SF cat’s death fuels Waymo criticism
item.description: The death of a neighborhood bodega cat named Kit Kat has shaken San Francisco’s Mission District and prompted new debates about robotaxi safety.

item.title: Amazon satellite network gets a rebrand — and drops its affordability pitch
item.description: The company has been quietly changing how it talks about who its internet customers will be before it announced a big name change last week.

item.title: 17 Best Gifts for PC Gamers (2025): Headsets, Desks, Monitors
item.description: It’s dangerous to go alone! Take these headsets, keyboards, and mice and give them to your favorite PC gamer.

item.title: The Best TVs We’ve Reviewed in 2025: Sony, Samsung, LG, and More
item.description: From LEDs to fancy OLED models, in 4K and beyond, these are our favorite televisions at every price.

item.title: Jury says Apple owes Masimo $634M for patent infringement
item.description: A federal jury in California ruled Friday that Apple must pay medical device maker Masimo $634 million for infringing a patent on blood oxygen monitor...

item.title: JPMorgan doesn’t want to pay Frank founder Charlie Javice’s legal bills
item.description: A lawyer representing JPMorgan said Javice’s legal team billed for expenses including luxury hotel upgrades, 24 hours of work in a single day, and cel...

item.title: Disney and YouTube TV reach deal to end blackout
item.description: You can watch "Jeopardy!" on YouTube TV again.
